intro: Koenigia ocreata, commonly known as the rock lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Koenigia ocreata is adapted to withstand drought and has a short growing season, typically blooming in late spring or early summer.
